info.title: Plough and Flail
info.address: Paddock Hill, Mobberley, Knutsford WA16 7DB, United Kingdom

data.text: Absolutely fantastic service as always, lovely atmosphere and superb food. Can't wait to go back. Highly recommended!
data.name: Peter Bull

data.text: A fantastic meal and excellent, friendly service.
data.name: Maggie Goodman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Maggie, we are glad to read you enjoyed the meal and the service and hope to see you again soon!

data.name: Carl O'Reilly
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Carl!

data.text: A modern pub with a country feel.  Only had a drink so unable to rate food
data.name: Karen Slater
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Karen!

data.text:
Visited on Thursday evening in a party of six.
Have visited here before over the years as I know many from these parts have too.
Really impresssd with the food, drinks and service. Everyone's plates were empty for every course.
Nice atmosphere here and especially so as it was dressed for Christmas.
The couple running place are great with service, attentive but not pushy.
Really impressed, highly recommend.
data.name: Tim Higgins
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Tim,

Thank you so much for your lovely review - your kind words are very much appreciated and make all the hard work worthwhile, I'll be sure to pass your comments to the wider team.

It was a pleasure serving you and we are all glad you enjoyed your meal. 

We hope to see you again very soon!

Kind regards,


Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: Best roast dinner we have had in a really long time! Highly recommend the sharing platter xx
data.name: charlotte collins
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the 5 stars and lovely review Charlotte! We are really glad you enjoyed our 'Sunday Sharer' and hope to see you again soon!

data.text: Lovely chips
data.name: David Morgan
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks David! We are glad you like the chips!

data.text: Love this pub food is excellent friendly atmosphere
data.name: Sally Warburton
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for the lovely review Sally! 

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: Good menu. Pleasant staff. Reasonably priced.
data.name: Mark Orth
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Mark,

Thank you for the 4 stars and the nice review. We hope to see you again soon.

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: We've been eating here for over 10 Years and the Sunday roast we had this week was probably the best I've had in my life. No exaggeration. New owners have done a Stirling job!
data.name: Ian Westlake
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Ian,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave us this review. It was a pleasure serving you and your family and we are extremely pleased you enjoyed your Sunday roast. We agree - we think they're amazing!

We hope to see you again soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: Came here for my partners 30th- table of 7 of us with two dogs. What a fantastic first visit. Food was outstanding - not a huge menu but everything was beautiful. So grateful for such great service and for where we were seated - right next to the cosy fire ! Thank you so much and can’t wait to return! All planning our next meals here haha! X
data.name: GMCR PHOTOG
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you so much for this lovely review! It's always pleasing to hear when our guests have enjoyed themselves and we are glad to have helped you celebrate your partner's 30th birthday - many happy returns!

We hope to see you again soon!

data.text:
Sunday lunch as a family (2adults 2 kids under 5) - Lovely atmosphere. It can get busy, so service was a tad slower. But workers all in good spirits, and lovely.
Shame the Alpaca's next door was out, but kids still saw a few horses walking past our table windows.
Food and drink was good. Sunday roast - can't go wrong. Burger and chips really tasty! And my kid ate all of his fish and chips + pudding.
Would thoroughly recommend for families
data.name: Joel Tay
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Joel,

Thanks for taking the time to leave us this lovely review, we are glad you enjoyed your visit. We can get really busy on Sundays so we always recommend booking where possible.

Thanks again and hopefully see you soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.name: Peter Annis
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Peter! We hope to see you again soon!

data.name: Kenneth Donaldson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Kenneth!

data.name: Joan Williams
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks Joan!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: Lovely place and lovely food too
data.name: peter smith
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Peter,

Thank you for the review and 5 star rating, it is greatly appreciated. We are glad to read you enjoy our food and our venue, we agree that it's a beautiful place to be.

We hope to see you again soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: Excellent food. Dog friendly areas. Highly recommended
data.name: Macclesfield Motorcycles
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks for the 5 star review! We are glad to read you enjoy our food. We have just launched our Autumn/Winter menu with lots of new exciting dishes to try. We hope to see you again soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.name: Anna Cohen
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Anna, we hope to see you again soon!

data.text: Great food good service very nice place and very dog friendly 👌🍻🥂
data.name: Arthur Moffatt
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Arthur, we're glad you like what we do! And yes we have plenty of space for dogs in the front of the pub so are always more than happy to welcome your furry friends! I am sure you made the most of our 'doggy bar'. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

data.text: Fantastic food and service. Very friendly atmosphere. Great to see a selection of classic and sports cars on a Thursday evening.
data.name: Gaven _
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Gaven,

Thanks for the lovely review! We are glad you enjoy the car meets (officially every other Thursday, next one being on 14-9-23) , it brings a lovely atmosphere and we enjoy having a nosey at all the lovely motors too!

We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.name: David Oldbury
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars David! We hope to see you again soon!

data.text: They put on a lovely funeral tea, so the questions below were not applicable.
data.name: Susan Cooper
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks Susan, hopefully you'll be back to try some of our delicious food soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: Did not eat, but food looked amazing that ither people were having. Plenty of space inside plus conservatory and lovely outdoor area.
data.name: Jan-Louise Blyth
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Jan-Louise,

Thanks for the review. Hopefully you'll be back to try some of our food sometime soon so we can show you we deserve that 5th star!

Thanks again,

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: I just live this place. Been there 4 times  and it's always a pleasure. Food is always good,service is great, there is a large car park and an area outside for kids to play. Pricing is not too bad either compared to others. Always happy to go there.
data.name: JM Mamet
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks for the kind words! We are glad you like visiting, we take great pride in what we do so it is always rewarding to hear positive feedback, so thanks again.

We hope to see you soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.name: Jean Moore
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Jean!

data.name: ALLAN TUNE
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks for the 5 starts Allan! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.name: George Lawson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks George!

data.text:
A catch up with friends.
A lovely warm welcome
Food delicious staff so friendly and helpful.
data.name: Su Constable
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you Su! We are really glad you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to see you again soon.

Dan Morris
General Manager

data.text: This is my favourite Cheshire country pub! Lovely setting both inside and out. We recently celebrated our daughter’s Christening with a wonderful family meal, most of us had the Sunday roast which was hearty and delicious. The staff were all so friendly and accommodating (we were a group of 16 and turned up 45 minutes early and they managed to seat & feed us quickly!) I would highly recommend this pub both in winter for cosy meals, and in summer to sit outside in the lovely beer garden.
data.name: Victoria Beheshti
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Victoria! It's really heart warming to read we are your favourite Cheshire country pub, and we are thrilled you had a nice time with us. We agree that we offer a lovely environment come rain or shine and we are really thankful to your family to making the journey out to visit us, we know we are a bit off the beaten track! Thanks again, we look forward to seeing you again soon!

data.text: Good Sunday lunch for a group of us. It was busy but service was great, very attentive. Food was good pub food, the sharing Sunday roast platter was huge and enjoyed. The steak and ale pie very nice too. The chocolate brownie an excellent way to round off the meal. We thoroughly enjoyed it, quality food good portions and great service. Sunday pub lunch done well.
data.name: Mark Thompson
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks Mark! We are glad you enjoyed your visit, it was a pleasure serving you. We hope to see you again soon.

Thanks,
Daniel Morris
General Manager

data.text: Great service provided, food very good, staff very nice !
data.name: Ray McCulloch
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Ray,
Thank you very much! We are glad you had a nice time and hope to see you soon.

data.text:
Thank you Laura and Dan.
Had a wonderful lunch in this gorgeous pub. Fantastic, friendly staff who provided great service. Looking forward to returning to sit in the garden when the sun comes out.
data.name: phoebe horn
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your lovely review Phoebe!

data.text: Nice setting for a drink food and walk
data.name: Gary Rudin
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Gary!

data.text: Food was lovely and service was great. Sam and Louis couldn’t do enough to help. Will definitely be back soon!
data.name: Molly Buckley
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Molly! Sam and Louis will be thrilled to hear that you enjoyed their service and we all look forward to seeing you next time!

data.text: such a lovely venue, gorgeous aesthetics and cozy atmosphere. food was amazing, made better by our lovely servers, sam and louis, who were so friendly and welcoming.
data.name: Holly Jukes
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Holly! We are really glad you enjoyed your time with us, I'll be sure to pass your comments on to Sam and Louis. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

data.text: Really nice place. Very popular with motor clubs.
data.name: m ashton
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a nice review, we really appreciate it. We are glad you enjoyed your pie! And we love the car and bike meets too, long may they continue!

data.name: Chris Grant
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Chris!

data.text: Nice cold beer sat outside after a bike ride 👌
data.name: Chris Edwards
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Chris, we're glad you enjoyed your bike ride and a well earned pint. We hope to see you again soon.

data.text: Dan and Laura are truly amazing, they make the place so welcoming
data.name: charlie
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Charlie, your comments mean the world - we couldn't do it without our amazing team though! Thanks again, we look forward to seeing you soon!

data.name: paul watson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Paul!

data.name: David Codling
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks David!

data.text:
Got to be one the best Sunday Roasts I have had in a pub.
Very friendly staff.
Will definitely be back. Thank you 😊
data.name: Sue Carlisle
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Sue! We are really glad you enjoy our roasts, and we think we have got a fantastic team, your kind words mean the world. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

data.text: Great country pub off the beaten track with a large open beer garden that gets lots of sunshine
data.name: graham shaw
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars and lovely review Graham!

data.text: Average quality  gammon steak, friendly staff, nice outdoor space.
data.name: V Niasar
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are sorry that you thought your gammon was average - average is not what we strive for. We hope to see you again and hopefully impress you next time!

data.text: We eat here around once a month and drink 2-3 times a month. At weekends the place is quite busy, that should speak for itself as there is no passing trade if you go down the road where this pub is there is very little else to do only go in here. Staff are good and food is usually okay
data.name: Mike Thomson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Mike! We do get exceptionally busy at weekends and always recommend booking if possible. We look forward to seeing you soon.

data.text: Poor meal undergone potatoes served not very warm
data.name: John Goodwin
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi John,
We are sad to read this. Please accept our sincere apologies that your potatoes were undercooked and not hot enough, this is not the standard we are striving for and I am disappointed that this wasn't dealt with at the time of your visit. I will discuss your comments with our front of house and kitchen teams and look to prevent this happening in future.
Thank you for leaving us some constructive feedback to be working with. We hope you'll give us another try soon.

data.text: Great pub lunch. But satnav has no idea where it is....
data.name: Sue Alexander
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are glad you enjoyed your lunch Sue! And we agree, SatNav's and Google maps etc. are sometimes not so helpful! If you wouldn't mind reporting any wrong routes it sends you on then Google might eventually get the message and update their maps! For any who are wondering we are only accessible from the Paddock Hill end of the road, the other direction (that leads to Moss Lane) is not accessible to vehicles. Thanks again for the review.

data.name: Deb Winstanley
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Deb!

data.text: Wonderful place, food very good and staff lovely
data.name: catherine molyneux
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Catherine! We are really glad you enjoyed your time with us and look forward to seeing you again soon!

data.text: Great pub lovely staff well done
data.name: Paul Butler
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Paul. Really glad you enjoyed your visit, I will pass your comments on to the team and I'm sure it will make their day. Thanks again, we hope to see you soon.

data.name: michael smith
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Michael!

data.text: Only stopped for a drink but what a beautiful public house.  Fantastic location, clean and modern toilets and the staff were lovely and friendly 👍😊
data.name: Andrea Hardy
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Andrea! We hope to see you again soon and maybe you can try our food next time and we can impress you further!

data.text: Krásná restaurace. Příjemná a dobře naladěná obsluha. Výborné jídlo!
data.name: Lucie Klinská
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the kind words and 5 stars Lucie! We hope to see you again soon.

data.text: Stumbled across the pub whilst on a walk to the Alpaca Farm across the road. Dan and Laura have done a fantastic job to make quite a large pub feel warm and cosy. We only stopped for a drink and some chips but the service was great and the prices too. We have a little man and the play area was a lot of fun with plenty of space to play football for the older kids.
data.name: Derek Tesciuba
data.responseFromOwnerText: Really glad you had a nice time with us Derek, and hope you enjoyed saying hello to our friendly Alpaca neighbours! Lovely photos too. We hope to see you again soon!

data.text: Great place and service!
data.name: Kleanthis K
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Kleanthis!

data.name: Michael Bridgeman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Michael!

data.text: The best Sunday roast and lovely staff
data.name: Lauren Brown
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are glad you enjoyed your roast Lauren! See you next time.

data.text: Must be 5 stars. Why? See the photos.
data.name: Sang Ip
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you! Lovely photos :)

data.text: Lovely hospitality for our running group on a Tuesday night, good beer, good chips and dog friendly
data.name: David Morris
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are glad you enjoyed your visit David, see you next time!

data.text: Much improved. Last night we revisited what was one of our regular venues, some 4 or 5 years ago. On the up once more. Both the food & service back to the old standards. By summer I hope that the car park will seem too small.
data.name: Stephen Scott
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review Stephen, we are really glad you enjoyed your visit!

data.text: Friendly staff in this comfortable country pub with nice beer and a good selection of wines. A nice warming open fire in the winter as well.
data.name: Dominic Kane
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the kind words Dominic, we are really glad you enjoyed your visit.

data.name: Josie Hart
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Josie!

data.text:
Saturday early evening meal for two.
Warm and cosy table in the bar. Well cooked Pan Fried Fillet of Sea bass on a haddock, spring onion and pea risotto for my wife. Red Pepper, mixed beans Aubergine chilli on a bed of rice for me. MPA beer on form and an enjoyable bottle of Gavi. It’s becoming a popular place again. Very good friendly service is one of the reasons backing up the much improved cooking and varied menu choices.
data.name: Kelvin Briggs
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the lovely review Kelvin! We are glad you enjoyed your time with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

data.text: Friendly staff. Menu is a bit limited for my taste, but good quality food
data.name: Karen Oldham
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Karen. We are sorry you didn't find that our menu offered enough variety. We are due to launch our Spring menu soon so hopefully that will be more to your liking.

data.text:
We had a lovely lunch yesterday the 17/2/23
The new refurbishment was excellent and the food once again was delicious!
I must say the management and staff are very attentive and interact with all the diners .great customer service!!
data.name: Gerard Cleary
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the kind words and 5 stars Gerard!

data.name: Thélise Rocquin
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Thélise!

data.text: Excellent service. The food was delicious. You must try the 3 cheese and onion pie.
data.name: Tony Vearnals
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Tony! Glad you liked the pie - we agree, it's delicious!

data.text: Dan and Laura have done an amazing renovation of the Plough and Flail in Mobberley since they purchased it recently. It's absolutely beautiful! We are locals and we're dying to get back to this wonderful pub and we are thrilled to welcome Dan and Laura to the area - they are so lovely, which makes a huge difference to the pub atmosphere. The food was beautiful and service is great. See you soon guys! Xx Anneliese and Hazel ❤️
data.name: Anneliese Estrada
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the kind words and 5 stars Anneliese! We look forward to your next visit!

data.text: Friendly , and a lovely atmosphere with welcoming staff
data.name: Julia Williamson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Glad you had a nice time Julia, thanks for taking the time to leave us 5 stars and a lovely review!

data.text: We went for lunch yesterday. Very disappointing. We all had the fish and chips. All batter and very small fish. We were given the wrong menu to start with and the whole experience was a total shambles. This pub is out of the way so they need to raise their game if they want repeat business. 🫤
data.name: David Hartley
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are sorry to hear this David, but we appreciate feedback both good and bad. We can only apologise that your experience wasn't up to the standards that we strive for on this occasion. If you would like to contact us directly about this we would be more than happy to discuss the points raised and hopefully convince you to give us another try as we are getting better and better every day!

data.name: Thomas Worthington
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Thomas!

data.text: Really good food and fantastic with allergens. Nice, fresh decor and friendly team. Definitely worth a visit!
data.name: Neil Gorman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Neil! Really glad you enjoyed your visit!

data.name: David Bloor
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 star review David!

data.name: Colin McDougall
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for leaving us a rating Colin. If you have any feedback on what we can do to earn that 5th star please let us know, we take all feedback seriously and are always looking to improve!

data.name: Adrian White
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Adrian!

data.text: Wonderful location and atmosphere. Under new management, only been there six weeks, made us feel very welcome. The Inn will be closed for three weeks from 2nd January 2023 and I am sure that when it reopens it will be a place to go for good food and great hospitality.
data.name: John Ringham
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the lovely review John, we hope to see you again soon!

data.text: Called in here for a quick bite to eat one lunchtime. Great food and friendly staff. Will definitely be coming back to this hidden gem.
data.name: simon morris
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the lovely review Simon!

data.text: Have been lots of times always good
data.name: Johnny Ricardo
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your review Johnny.

data.name: Peter Burgess
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a rating Peter. Hopefully on your next visit we will earn that 5th star!

data.name: punit gor
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review.

data.name: James Stonehewer
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars James.

data.text: New landlords great couple help them turn this place around
data.name: Raymond Smith
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your lovely review Raymond.

data.text: What a great warm welcome from the new managers the food was cooked well and I will recommend this place anytime
data.name: Ian Price
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the fantastic review Ian.

data.text: Excellent
data.name: AKOR CHIDI
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars!

data.text: Lovely food, very helpful friendly staff
data.name: Daniel Rose
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your lovely review Daniel.

data.text: For the last few months we have been eating out on a Sunday at various pubs. This has been the best. We did have a bit of a wait but didn't mind once the food arrived. Lots of  well cooked veg with it. Delicious.
data.name: Barbara Dunn
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for the great review Barbara and thank you for your patience!

data.text: Very plain lunch time meal.
data.name: John Birch
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are very sorry you didn't have the best experience on your visit John. We have seen a lot of changes since then, including an almost entirely new team, so we would love for you to give us another try and hopefully we will impress you this time.

data.text: great place to be
data.name: Ezekwesiri Ahanonu
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your kind words and 5 stars Ezekwesiri!

data.text: Lovely country pub with countryside walks all around it. Really nice food and cosy atmosphere. Staff are really nice and welcoming too.
data.name: Kate Merica
data.responseFromOwnerText: Really glad you enjoyed your visit Kate. :) Thanks for the review and the 5 stars!

data.text: Service and attitude of staff totally unacceptable.  We walked out after almost an hour, just as our humus/bread starter arrived, thank goodness we didn’t have to eat it, a loaf of gluey looking bread and a thimble of lumpy humus!
data.name: Pam Evans
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are really sorry about your negative experience Pam. We have an almost entirely new team including new managers since your visit, so we really hope you'll give us another chance soon and hopefully we will impress this time!

data.text:
We had a meal tonight me and my partner, we over heard a joke being
Made between two members off staff there was a young girl must have been in her 20s being abused by another member of staff, this poor girl looked as if she was going to cry the food was OK but what we had witnessed today we certainly will not be returning.
data.name: Harley Nugent2
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are very sorry about this experience Harley and understand that this would put you off visiting again, it certainly sounds unacceptable. We have, however, got an almost entirely new team now (including new managers) and we would be thrilled if you gave us another chance to impress.

data.text: The staff were very rude they were calling a young pour girl an elephant who was a staff member infront off the whole pub and all the staff were laughing everyone felt uncomfortable this shouldn’t Be happening food was ok jst staff very poor
data.name: Tim Daniels
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are very sorry about this experience Tim, it sounds completely unacceptable. We have seen a lot of changes since your visit, including new managers and an almost entirely new team, so we really hope you will give us another chance.

data.name: Dave Ashworth
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are sorry you only felt your visit warranted 2 stars Dave, we hope to impress if you visit again - the Plough and Flail has seen a lot of changes recently and we hope we would earn a few more stars if you gave us another shot!

data.text: Great food, good staff.
data.name: James Atkinson (Rubarbb)
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the good review and 5 stars James!

data.text: The Plough and Flail is truly a hidden gem. The staff are very friendly and attentive. We ordered food from the special's board - a sharing platter of meats which came with onion rings, skin-on chips (not fries) and salad. The meal was better than I could have anticipated and well priced to boot! The wine and beer didn't disappoint either - couldn't have asked for more!!
data.name: Gibb Wilson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the kind words and 5 stars Gibb!

data.name: Julie Guard
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Julie!

data.text:
Nice pub
Located near to farm lands
Beautiful place to sit and chill
Food is yummy but little bit oily
Staff is really friendly
Good atmosphere to have some drinks
data.name: Hema Latha
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the review Hema! We have made quite a few changes since your  visit so hopefully we will earn that 5th star next time!

data.text: Lovely country pub with friendly staff
data.name: Mark Forsythe
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Mark!

data.text: Great food and great people
data.name: Peter Williams
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the kind words and 5 stars Peter!

data.name: Christine Leamy
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Christine!

data.text: Food was lovely, had a great time with the family x
data.name: Michelle Fallon
data.responseFromOwnerText: Glad you enjoyed your visit Michelle, thank you!

data.text: Nice pint of real ale, friendly service and handy play area for grandchild.
data.name: Pete A
data.responseFromOwnerText: Glad you enjoyed your visit Pete, thanks for taking the time to leave a review and 5 stars!

data.text: Awful atmosphere! food was equally as awful! the service is terrible! won't be going back again! my mates either.
data.name: Grime
data.responseFromOwnerText: Sorry to hear this Grime. The Plough and Flail now has new management and a largely new team in the kitchen and out front, as well as a new menu, so we hope you'll give us another chance!

data.text:
We got seated in the conservatory.
My pint of peroni needed a flake to put on the top! The roast was awful...No atmosphere in the place!!
data.name: Calum Wardman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Sorry to read about your negative experience Calum. The Plough & Flail has seen a lot of changes since your last visit so we hope to impress if you give us another try :)

data.name: Alan Dupre
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Alan!

data.text: Great traditional pub. Good range of beers and fantastic service.
data.name: Martin Hart
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Martin!

data.text: Only called for a drink this time and found a seat outside despite the good weather. Plenty of seating inside also and great for kids outside. Lovely outside area. Nice pint of Lees bitter.
data.name: david lundy
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks David!

data.name: Jonny Franklin
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the 5 stars Jonny!

data.name: Az Hughes (Azz)
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Az :)

data.text: We sat outside which in the sunshine was lovely but we were plagued by flys and wasps. We ordered fish n chips which was OK but not the best the fish was grey and a bit dry but I was so hungry I did not want to complain my friend ordered steak pie and what was supposed to be chunky chips which they wernt and again not come out to complain ! But I thought I needed to say in all service was good food came quickly and was hot but its a 6/10 for quality.
data.name: Cary Peterman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Cary. We are sorry your food was not up to the standard we strive for. The Plough and Flail has seen a lot of changes since your visit so hopefully we will impress next time!

data.text:
Lunch today (Friday Aug 12th).
Was excellent. Three of us were well looked after by very pleasant staff( you felt that from the heart  that Customers pay their wages).
Good menu, we chose from the specials board --- based Sea Bream. Food was served promptly, well presented and extremely well cooked. All in all a very enjoyable meal with very pleasant and friendly staff. A hidden gem I the countryside. Will definitely visit again.
Overall, excellent
data.name: Bob Owen
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the kind words and 5 stars Bob!

data.text: Lovely and quaint country pub. Went there for a classic car meet and the staff were lovely.
data.name: Andy Whittaker
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you Andy!

data.text:
Very disappointed with the food on 3rd August
I can only assume that the cook was different or absent as previously the meals were very good
Not sure if we will return
data.name: Graham Haughton
data.responseFromOwnerText: Sorry to read that you were disappointed on your visit Graham. The Plough and Flail has seen quite a few changes since then so we hope you will consider giving us another try!

data.text: Lovely staff, dog friendly & welcoming 😁
data.name: Mike Tucker
data.responseFromOwnerText: Glad you had a nice time Mike, thanks for the review!

data.text: Not as good as it used to be.
data.name: Gina Thompson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Gina. We are sorry that you think the Plough and Flail has gone downhill - we have a new management team and lots of other changes since your visit, so we hope you'll give us another chance to show you we are back on the right track!

data.name: Tim Ellis
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Tim!

data.name: Peter Coates
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Peter!

data.text:
Food good but have had better...cheese pie tasty but could have made same type at home...Good service and dog friendly
Has a good play area for children but the way in/out and car park inbetween
data.name: David Hagley
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the review David. We hope you'll come and try our cheese pie again - we have seen quite a few changes at the Plough and Flail recently and truly believe our cheese pie is now a real winner!

data.name: Faye Lageu
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Faye!

data.name: Christine Henney
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for taking the time to leave a rating Christine. We hope you'll try us again soon so we can show you all the changes we made recently and hopefully prove we are better than a 3 star venue!

data.text: Went with party of about 15 people they forgot about my main coarse by time I had got it people on my table had nearly finnished no discount or other of a free desert or coffee so not so great service ... food was great
data.name: Simon Plews
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Simon. Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. Sorry to hear about the issue with your meal and the way it was handled. We have seen a lot of changes recently so hopefully if you visit again we will really impress!

data.text: Lovely meal, excellent service.
data.name: Emma Green

data.text: Excellent service and good value for money. Friendly staff
data.name: Julie Williams

data.text: Lovely place to be. Excllent service, Great food. Pet friendly
data.name: Eben Offei

data.text: Sat outside with my dogs in the sunshine.  Friendly staff - Brought doggie treets out to the dogs and water available for them.
data.name: irene bramwell

data.text: My friends and I get together once a month to go for Sunday Lunch. This was the worst experience we have had. It took very long between the starter and main course. The main course states it has mash potatoes, roast potatoes, swede, etc etc.  The mash was one teaspoon, the swede one teaspoon, etc. The greens were absolutely ice cold, so were the parsnips, roast potatoes in the middle and the whole plate in general. I complained twice and when the waiter was asked by another member of staff what was wrong he replied, ‘nothing, I do not see why she is complaining’. TOUCH THE POTATOES AND VEGETABLES. Then he comes out and the beef is cold and so is the rest of the food. The manager could not even come and apologise. They did not charge for the desserts and coffee but guess what….the person that complained did not have dessert or coffee. The staff were rushed off their feet though it was not busy at all. I supposed that should have given us an indication because Sunday Lunch places are hard to find on the spot. Even when I asked for the left overs to be packed so I could give it to the dog, there was no reaction. Never going back.
data.name: Christine Martins

data.text: Great atmosphere and staff. Had the sea bass, beautifully cooked. Thoroughly recommend it
data.name: Cynthia Jackson

data.text: My first time here our food was very good and good value nice pint too
data.name: Matthew Brooks

data.text: Vegetarian Sunday roast with roast potatoes cooked in goose fat?? and no substitute offered, so less food for the same price, they won't see our crowd again.
data.name: Carl Clarke

data.text:
Location is fantastic, great beer/ ale but the food was dreadful!

Would recommend for a beer but don’t eat there!
data.name: Peter Simpson

data.text: Food was very average,  they offered a vegetarian roast for Sunday lunch, but then no alternative to goose fat roast potatoes, we were told they used to have new potatoes but took them off the menu!! Don't offer a meal that you cannot provide in full and the only solution is to remove a main component with no substitution and then charge the full price.  They rest of the meal was over cooked and the roast tasteless.   Definitely will not be rushing back.
data.name: Jan Clarke

data.text:
It's not as good as it used to be.

The food was nice and the service attentive
data.name: Ian May

data.text: Manchester craft beer was delicious
data.name: Heidi Cowen

data.text: Lovely food. Good prices. Steak and ale pie mmmmm.
data.name: D Wolverson

data.text: Lovely food, pleasant staff and relaxing atmosphere
data.name: Carolyn Hall

data.text: Smiles from staff, prompt service, well cooked food nice ambiance., comprehensive menu
data.name: linda horrocks

data.text: Our local some 50+ years ago!  Big changes,of course , since then.  Loved it such a nostalgic "blast from the past".
data.name: Jen Coops

data.text: Good food and service in proper country pub
data.name: Chris Shea

data.text:
Warm, welcoming, excellent food and dog friendly. Visited whilst house sitting both for lunch and evening meal.
Best book to ensure your place!
data.name: Janet Bell

data.text: Really nice Sunday roast,  friendly service. Good to see a local pub so busy...
data.name: Richard Harrison

data.text: Fantastic food again and slick service. Faultless
data.name: David Nelson

data.text: We had a fantastic fantastic family meal just before Christmas.
data.name: Roger Rustom (Risk Management Refreshed)

data.text:
Nice pub, awful food.  Not family friendly.
We ordered sharing food- pate, whitebait, humous, fries, etc.   It was all really bad, ended up leaving most of it.
No straws, kids stuff to keep them entertained, etc.
data.name: Stuart B

data.text: What a disappointment. We’ve been going to the Plough and Flail for years and wondered why the car park was empty when we arrived. The food was terrible. It used to be a fantastic gastro pub but the quality of the food was awful last night. Such a shame and we won’t be going back.
data.name: J J

data.text: Lovely place and food
data.name: Rob Andrews

data.text: Friendly service and fantastic food, highly recommended
data.name: Justin Arnold

data.text: Good food, good selection of beer. Prices are slightly on the high end but nothing unreasonable. Very dog friendly. Service is good and quick, although I've only been when it was at most moderately busy so I haven't seem them full. Limited wine selection, although the few that they do have are quite varied.
data.name: Kareem Moustafa

data.text: Very good menu, and fantastic service definitely going back
data.name: Tony Milward

data.text: Loved it and booked to go again.  Cheese and onion pie gorgeous 😋
data.name: Pauline Lang

data.text: Amazing place, great staff and superb food!! A*
data.name: Antony Morris

data.text: Very nice atmosphere food good service great plenty of parking.
data.name: DEREK ATKINS

data.text: This pub supports the Cheshire Hunt. 80% of the UK's population is opposed to foxhunting, if you're part that 4/5, please consider spending your money elsewhere.
data.name: Jon Tiltman

data.text: Good food and good atmosphere. Friendly and helpful staff.
data.name: Andrew Goldthorpe

data.text: Lovely pub. Very horse friendly and accomadating.
data.name: Vic

data.text: We love the Plough and Flail. Always welcoming and 100% dog friendly  The food is always excellent and superb value . Highly recommended.
data.name: Pete Barry

data.text: Tasteless bruschetta with pale tomatoes, fish platter for sharing was fried too heavily and lacked flavor. All in all disappointing food but nice service in lovely surrounding. Kids play area could do with more than one climbing item.
data.name: Gitte Barknowitz

data.text: £5,85 for a pint of Peroni and it was flat as hell
data.name: t-rex ryan Blair

data.text: Food was lovely. Very reasonably price, good portion. Friendly and efficient service. Great atmosphere! All in all we had a great time.
data.name: Shelvina Davies

data.text: Tasteless boring food. No flavour and plenty of watery cabbage to water down the tasteless sauce. The place was lovely, the staff were really attentive.  Really disappointing. 3 starters, 3 mains and 3 puddings and none enjoyed.
data.name: Sam xx

data.text: Food looked amazing but tasted absolutely terrible there was no lamb on my shank the chicken was over done wouldn't go again the girl that served us was really nice though
data.name: Luke Gamble

data.text: Ordinary pub which has lost character from the original building and the beer is just as ordinary.
data.name: Rick Newton

data.text: Nice and friendly,  price reasonable 👍
data.name: Matthew Elmes

data.text: Nice Sunday lunch
data.name: Gary Firth

data.text: Great food excellent service with friendly staff
data.name: Garry Rowlands

data.text: We sat at the back very nice and comfortable,staff very bright and attentive,and nothing was too much trouble,service was quick and efficient,and we all had a wonderful time
data.name: Jonathan Page

data.text:
Visited this establishment today
Have to say the service was very poor. Waiting a good 20 min for a glass of wine is not acceptable.then after eating our main course the plates were notcleared leading to a fly nfestation then Forty min to order a pudding.
data.name: Paul Davies

data.text: Always lovely food!!! Never disappoints!
data.name: Lucia Kovacova

data.text: Excellent food and ambience
data.name: Kevin Howarth

data.text: Really good food, requested table in shade and recieved one, not too busy. Only downside is usual for most pubs no child friendly cutlery or crockery. Also playground for kids in a bit of disrepair.
data.name: Kate Duffus

data.text: Proper country pub, nice food, nice people, tight country lanes to drive there. Walkable footpaths from either Mobberley or Wilmslow.
data.name: Gill Walsh

data.text: Nice place. Give it a try.
data.name: Camelia B

data.text: Only completed a delivery but lovely Pub/restaurant also staff and manager helpful and nothing was a problem few people having food looked amazing and smelt just as nice 👍👍
data.name: Roger Ingham

data.text: Warm welcome. Generous portion size. Gets busy. Beware narrow road.
data.name: Alan Taylor

data.text: Good food, friendly service, speedy delivery to tables.
data.name: David Custerson

data.text:
Fantastic pub, beautiful surroundings by the Alpacas.
Great wedding venue.
data.name: TheGet BackBeats

data.text: Lovely place, we had amazing roast lunch!!! Staff were friendly and attentive. Nice outdoor seating area and play area for children!
data.name: Victoria Cole

data.text: Great place to visit
data.name: Gerald Tebb

data.text: We had a beautiful lunch set in lovely surroundings, plenty of choice on the menu and all was all really tasty. A very relaxed atmosphere, we will definitely be going back. Thanks!
data.name: Richard Flanagan

data.text: Was nice to go back here again, however the  benches on the pasture behind the pub have been removed. Those three benches as simple as they are were what made the pub.
data.name: Bambi Adams

data.text: Loved their food, great service and ambience,  friendly staff.
data.name: Rohan Shoaib

data.text: We went for Sunday lunch on the bank holiday weekend. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and couldn'tbe helpful,  and the food was excellent well worth the wait.
data.name: Alison Nicholson

data.text: Wasn't impressed with sharing fish plate, there must have been 10 dogs owners there with about 15 dogs yapping and barking, a real turn off for me, so much for a quiet afternoon lunch, won't be back, staff are friendly though and helpful.
data.name: David Kennedy

data.text: Nice place, good food, reasonably priced.
data.name: Les Dash

data.text: Brilliant place and the food is absolutely gorgeous
data.name: Steven Donaldson

data.text: Lovely pub inside and out.
data.name: L M

data.text: Excellent  pub restaurant  wide choice of  menu very welcoming staff and frist first class wone list.
data.name: isabella obrien

data.text: Had a wonderful lunch in the beer garden, very pleasant and clean pub. Would be great to see more vegetarian choices on the menu.
data.name: Ryan Smith

data.text: Excellent service, terrific choice on the menu to suit our three generation family group. Environment felt safe and friendly with all precautions adhered to and seating under covered area outside the main building.
data.name: J W Sherlock

data.text:
Great food served very safely in the garden.
Friendly staff
data.name: Janet Brown

data.text:
Edit: 1 year later and the food still amazing, customer service best around.
Really great standards. Excellent food and proper portions
data.name: Adam Ogiliev

data.text:
Good food in a lovely setting
X
data.name: Anne Wood

data.text: Great to have open again after lockdown! Staff are always friendly. Food good and average priced for the area. Kids play area and big grass area make it a good place for families in summer. COVID: one way system in place. Great outdoor space which is undercover with heaters.
data.name: Ed Clapham

data.text: Excellent food with great service in an out of the way place that I'd love to try in the summer. It was cold, wet and dark outside when I visited but that made it feel more of a treat
data.name: Dave Baxter

data.text: Given current restrictions this country pub is doing its best to make customers feel welcome and safe. The food was good (3 courses from festive menu) and value for money. The pub has plenty of space both inside and outside and the potential to be extremely popular in better times and better weather. I would recommend  a visit.
data.name: Nigel Blackley

data.text: I came for Sunday lunch 6th December I had not booked. However we managed to get a table. My daughter and I ordered a Sunday roast beef dinner, waited 40 minutes  and when the dinner arrived it was warm but I have to say it is the worst roast dinner I have ever eaten the well done beef was so hard it was inedible, the medium was so over cooked it was uneatable, we asked for the manager who came and looked at it and said can i get you something else, we said no we asked for the bill we were charged for one roast beef both of us had one potato, some yorkshire pudding the rest was unpalatable. I would never go to the plough and flail again, Jean Capaldi
data.name: Jean Capaldi

data.text: Great atmosphere, lovely staff. Had the special sea bream which was fresh. Also dessert was picture worthy
data.name: Kyra

data.text: Fantastic hospitality
data.name: Steve Larkin

data.text: Always enjoy the Plough & Flail
data.name: Ali Truman

data.text: Lovely food and great staff
data.name: Jemma Ashton

data.text: Good value, good quality, classic pub grub. A great place with very friendly staff.
data.name: Paul Coyne

data.text: Good service
data.name: Jeffrey Turner

data.text: 7.45 booking and food arrived at 9.15pm. Disappointing
data.name: Irene Spawton

data.text: Great beer garden
data.name: David Watson

data.text: First time here for sunday dinner and it was fantastic. Great portion size and fair price for 2 courses. The staff were attentive and polite. Especially loved the effort to provide a dog mat, water and biscuits to the furry one of the 3 of us. Will be back easily.
data.name: Nwood06

data.text: Lovely food
data.name: Tracey Goodwin

data.text: Like the place  good food and service
data.name: Robert 43 Timperley

data.text: Too many customers and not enough staff. Difficult to maintain social distancing
data.name: Anne Hillier

data.text: Dropped in for a drink this afternoon. As ever, not enough staff on the bar. It’s been like this for years here, but obviously worse now because of Covid. Took 25 mins to get served! Staff were overworked and less than joyful as a result. It’s my experience over the years that this place has always been geared to looking after diners. I didn’t eat here so I’m not qualified to comment on the service to diners. Because of its great location, it’s always busy, but if you’re after a good beer and good service, go elsewhere.
data.name: Andy From Wilmslow

data.text: Excellent meal with great service served by very pleasant staff.
data.name: Barry Smith

data.text: Good food, the sharing fish platter is amazing. They were a little overstretched service wise but the spacing of tables and attention to social distancing and Covid19 rules were perfectly observed. A one way system was in place.
data.name: Phil Barton

data.text: Stopped by for lunch lovely staff easy access even in these uncertain times food great very busy which I see as a good sign when going to eat anywhere. Well worth going for lunch or dinner environment is a great lovely country pub..definitely going again
data.name: Andrew Walker

data.text: Had an excellent dinner here, the food was well prepared and tasted excellent. The staff were very friendly and attentive and the prices were reasonable considering the super food, excellent surroundings and comfortable seating
data.name: Christopher Harding

data.text: Great food and service!
data.name: Matt Clarke

data.text: Great, friendly service!
data.name: David Baugh

data.text: Good beer good food friendly staff
data.name: Andrew Goldthorpe

data.text: Very well recieved service very good food exellent.
data.name: Ronald Ferguson

data.text:
Loved my visit back to the plough after lockdown.
Food was amazing and the staff welcoming,  such a chilled atmosphere, looking forward to going back soon.
data.name: Angel A

data.text: Fab
data.name: Clare Hollis

data.text: The P&F has been a bit of a rollercoaster in terms of the quality of food and service but it’s definitely on the up at the moment. We’ve visited a few times  since lockdown, the pub is in a great location and has one of the best beer gardens/play areas around. The food is a decent quality (the burger is great) and service prompt, long may it continue. It’s also dog friendly.
data.name: Ben Salamon

data.text: Lovely lunch in a fantastic setting
data.name: Ian Waddell

data.text: Traditional menu   lovely outdoor eating area . Bit pricey but definitely worth a visit.
data.name: Ian G

data.text: Really nice setting, esp on a sunny day, there are some great walks around it and it's next to an Alpaca farm.. The staff are friendly and helpful, the menu is varied and the food is excellent.. would definitely recommend.
data.name: Nick Gardner

data.text: Lovely venue and staff were very pleasant and helpful. More attention to covid hygiene would be good. Food was ok but was expecting a little better. Sunset over Cheshire was good.
data.name: Ian

data.text: Great Sunday roast, although the beef was a bit tough. Have children's playground but it is across the car park. Dogs allowed. Friendly service.
data.name: Ruth Richardson

data.text: Lovely country pub, amazing food and great service. Would highly recommend.
data.name: Penny Harvey

data.text:
Smart at a price.
Only serving 2 course Sunday lunches at inflated prices.
No bar snacks like sandwiches.
Expencive packs of chrisps at £1.10 per small bag.
Maybe not the best PR in inviting the public back after lockdown.
data.name: simon mendelson

data.text: First time here,The staff here were brilliant. Will be coming back that's for sure
data.name: John Croft

data.text:
First time visit although our son and daughter in law visit regularly.
What a refreshing change to find a lovely pub with staff in the kitchen who can cook. Gorgeous Sunday lunch, lovely welcome and great and efficient staff. Nothing too much trouble for baby and dog. Highly recommend this lovely pub. Thank you.
data.name: Chris O'Dwyer

data.text: Meals was very good staff excellent prices good
data.name: Liam Odwyer

data.text: Great location and food was lovely. They were accommodating by warming up baby meal for my son and they had games, books around for usage.
data.name: Melanie White

data.text: Made us feel very welcome had a delicious Sunday roast well worth the money.
data.name: Ann Dolan

data.text: Just had a lovely meal, best cheesecake I've ever had!
data.name: john lowe

data.text: Nice and quiet place great for walks we loved alpaca farm. Was good experience.
data.name: Beata Kosmecka

data.text: Came for a Christmas dinner. Spent £250. Way overpriced. Poor service. Heating control all over the place. Management had bad attitude. I didn't complain.  But know this, I live walking distance and won't ever come in. That's the best way to complain. The only reason I gave 2 stars, was because the  business is well invested by JW lee's and looks stunning. Please be aware your 'oversize' pint glasses, don't have a line on them showing the pint mark. So they aren't 'oversize'. Stop ripping customers off illegally. It's really bad.
data.name: Jason Jennings

data.text: Great atmosphere, nice and cosy. Dodnt eat here but had a nice hot chocolate to warm up after our Alpaca experience
data.name: Charlene Tolmie

data.text: Avoid the food. Not fully cooked, frozen in middle. Took forever to come out, lacklustre staff
data.name: R J

data.text: Lovely food excellent service.
data.name: Jayne Worthington

data.text: Sunday dinner. Seated without booking, quick service and great food. Great pub, plenty of character and good people. Recommended.
data.name: Damian Shaw

data.text: Very good pab
data.name: renato cabral

data.text: More like plough and fail. I had a horrible experience 2 days ago when me and my family went. The waitress kept on smashing glasses and was obviously not trained very well. The drinks were nice but when me and my friends went to the play area we were told that we were too big and we needed to get off by a grumpy man who we assumed was the manager.
data.name: Anna Philpotts

data.text: Good food, good menu & plentiful.  Enjoyed our coffee by an open fire.   Good service & friendly.
data.name: Lara Webster

data.text: Fabulous food and excellent service, very impressed.
data.name: Anne KD

data.text: Was for funeral
data.name: William Brocklehurst

data.text: Nice food, nice place, but soo sloow. The same slow service last time we were here to.
data.name: Mark Crossley

data.text: Great place to eat friendly staff and nice atmosphere.
data.name: Andy Buckley

data.text: Great food, great service!
data.name: Tony Simpson

data.text:
Great food...nice beers.
Overall very nice indeed
data.name: Ian Crawford

data.text: Good pub grub in a wonderful atmospheric pub. Excellent selection of beers.
data.name: Rishi Sethi

data.text: Good meal and service will definitely go again.
data.name: Barrie Rogers

data.text: Good food and beer. A bit remote but worth the visit.
data.name: Peter Don-Duncan

data.text:
Just returned from having a very poor Sunday lunch experience, should of had an idea as to how things were going to go from the wet weekend look on our waitresses face ! She said she would be back to take our order for drinks, after ten mins I had to go to the bar and order them ok they were busy I thought. The food arrived quite some time later delivered by a young man, I asked about the drinks "I'll go and hecheck sir"
He came back apologised as the drinks order had been mislaid and he took our drinks order again my wife had ordered a prosecco which arrived in a small bottle (when did the d-i-y culture bestart).
The food was just about warm enough to eat, again I thought they're very busy, the man on the next table had to re-order his drinks three times and he wasn't happy ! By this time I was beginning not to make excuses for the poor service now I was realising that the staff (all youngsters) had not had appropriate training. When i wanted to pay, a young man asked what table we were on and after having told him three times he tried a contactless payment for a bill of £35+  I had to tell him that he needed to insert my card into machine to make a payment over £30. Before leaving I wanted to make my feelings known to management but was told that the manager was away and that Pedro was available but he was not to be found, the person I spoke to apologised and said most of the problems were caused by management ..
data.name: Robert Harvey

data.text: Nice position foods very good service disappointing
data.name: Peter Howe

data.text: Nostalgic revisit after nearly 40 years. Still hidden away but found it thanks to google
data.name: col bucknor

data.text: Good play area for the kids. Food was nice but order's came incorrect for mains and dessert. Young waitress rolled her eyes when we complained. Was given kids deserts with our adults desserts and was told they all come the same.
data.name: Mark Smallman

data.text: A lovely place with nice rural spirit. Tasty food (apart of the beef roast-completely bland). Avoid at busy times (Fri, Sat, Sun) as likely to experience lack of the staff. Manager's attititude and language to the staff is shocking. Peace out!
data.name: Ctrl Esc1

data.text: Good pint, empty for such a glorious early doors
data.name: James Russell

data.text: Nice Staff Food and Drinks! Really loved the experience!
data.name: Bruno Feitosa

data.text: Good food and drink.
data.name: Tony Clark

data.text: Great food, great service and beautiful surroundings! Who could ask for more?
data.name: Ross Carter

data.text: Must have been served by the manager as stated by someone else, grumpy impatient man. Ordered drinks including a coffee the way he asked us where we were sitting and i replied outside he growled back saying he needed to know to send it out which was understandable but his manner was terrible then short changed me but dashed off before i could tell him. Didn't even send the coffe out but just left it on the bar. Decided not to bother eating.
data.name: david garvey

data.text: Friendly pub with Great food. Well recommended.
data.name: Paul Lockwood

data.text:
went with a party of four on 24-07-2019 and requested the advertised taste of the plough which is on the four square plough and flail web site.
Was told no such menu is available and were presented with a July lunch menu
We placed our order and I ordered the fish pie when it arrived  it included broccoli and cabbage which was uncooked
The four meals ordered were not up to the  usual standard and we left dissatisfied with the whole experience
Having been a customer of the plough and flail for many years and been happy with the quality of the food I will be reluctant to attend for a meal until the quality returns to its previous standards
data.name: Graham Bailey

data.text: Food below previous standard -  service uninspiring
data.name: Charles Henderson

data.text: We went for my birthday lunch yesterday with  our little dog in tow..We were made to feel really welcome by pedro our waiter who really looked after us all.The food was superb and a great lunch time choice.my wife and I  had the lovely home made cheese and onion pie and my mother chose the sea bass.being my birthday we had to try the puddings too and that was really yummy.The pub is in a beautiful setting and is all clean and bright with Plenty of seating inside and out.
data.name: Clinton Neylan

data.text:
Not a good experience I'm afraid. My mum and I went for lunch today, Steve  the manager was the most grumpy person I had come across. The chips had  to be sent back as they were cold and greasy.  I was told it's because they are 'homemade'
Such ashame, this used to be a lovely place a few years ago.
data.name: Sarah Stokes

data.text: Poor beer selection
data.name: Andrew Hunter

data.text: Lovely food, and good wine choice. Sunday roast fab. Large outdoor open or covered dining areas. Doggie friendly, free treats and lots of water bowls. A lovely walk from Wilmslow, with rewards at the end. Nice play area slide, turret, climbing for children.
data.name: Deborah Walsh

data.text: Lovely out of the way pub diner.
data.name: Geo Bingham

data.text: Friendly staff and nice surroundings.
data.name: Patricia Lynch

data.text: Great food, lovely atmosphere and very friendly staff. Nice to go to a truly traditional pub.
data.name: Helen Boardman

data.text: Poor service.  Under staffed.  Booked for 2.30.  Ate at 4.00
data.name: Sian Bufton

data.text: Great pub food and good for groups
data.name: Eleri Murphy

data.text: Myself and husband love it here food is amazing as are the staff
data.name: Mandy Gardiner

data.text: Great place to walk to on a sunny day. Kids can run around while you sit and enjoy the surroundings. It's not too bad when it's raining either!
data.name: Simon Rogers

data.text: Really lovely food staff very pleasent  and  good value for money  definatley recomend to freinds
data.name: Christine Maddocks

data.text: Awful service dreadful food
data.name: sarah swift

data.text: good
data.name: Gareth Jones

data.text: Very good and friendly
data.name: andrew hearn

data.text: Nice place but only Lees beers.
data.name: phil clifton

data.text: Friendly place where the MG Car Club meets every third Tuesday evening monthly.
data.name: Jonny Pollard

data.text: Nice location and setting. Play area for children
data.name: Rachael Fennessey

data.text: Food was lovely, did take a little while but staff keep us updated. Customer service was great from booking the table till the moment we left. Will visit again.
data.name: Gareth Norbury

data.text: Great food and atmosphere
data.name: Chris Garland

data.text: Nice pub though a little chilly and quite empty with only two other tables dining. Food portions for chicken were a little small but tasty. It was a thursday evening between 8 and 9.
data.name: Northern Monkey

data.text: The wine is good, the food is excellent. Staff are friendly and they serve a good range of ales. Decor and feel of the place is super too. Definitely recommend!
data.name: Antony Bambury

data.text: Food was good but noticed the barman putting lemon in a drink with his hands ... noooo !
data.name: Helen Bucke

data.text: Nice quiet pint on an early Saturday lunchtime. I was thoroughly impressed by the honesty and integrity of the staff after they returned a large amount of change that my friend accidentally left on the bar.  Nice pint as well. I didn't eat, but the food looked great.
data.name: David Swan

data.text: Lovely food and great service.  Can strongly recommend.

data.text: Poor. We had booked weeks in advance. No Christmas menu unless you pre book, order and pay deposit. Table booked for 7.30pm to be told no steaks left. They only have 15 for the whole weekend. Lack lustre decorations no festive feel about the place how this lovely pub has gone down hill over the years. Very disappointed

data.text: Great food, fab countryside location. lovely open terrace at the back and plenty of indoor space. a little off the beaten track but worth following sat nav

data.text: A really excellent pub in a lovely, hidden-away location. Classy interiors throughout with a well heeled clientele and high quality food & drink to match. Large car park and a nice play area for kids. Normally a consistent range of well kept real ales.

data.text: Allows dogs in. Quality food. Lovely atmosphere.

data.text: Lovely country pub with some great food in a secluded but stunning locale

data.text: Excellent food and service.
data.name: Antony McGarr

data.text: Paget Family Had booked a table in the Conservatory for an important birthday celebration. On arrival told that the booked table was unavailable. The table given was sticky since it had not been cleaned properly. There was dropped food under the table. Service was inattentive and sloppy. I had to leave the table to get drinks. The response was..“ I don’t usually serve drinks.”When the drinks arrived, designer gins were in wine glasses. No children’s menu offered. The food was tasty and enjoyable. The pub was suffering from a shortage of trained staff. We have eaten here many times and were surprised at the fall in standards. It was a poor and regrettable experience which will not be repeated in our presence.
data.name: John Paget

data.text: Nice array of drinks and food available.
data.name: Sara

data.text:
Have been here a few times in the past and was wonderful, have since visited since it was taken over by jw lees. Service was extremely slow... Ordered the Sunday roast, worst cut of beef I have ever been served, completely inedible. Yorkshire and potatoes were straight out of the freezer...
Terrible shame, won't be going back
data.name: sean b (retrocon)

data.text: Lovely little pub, close to alpaca farm. Good food
data.name: christelle lightfoot

data.text: Very nice atmosphere, the food was delicious. Cost a little more than I would usually spend on lunch but we thoroughly enjoyed it. Visited the Alpaca farm opposite first. A treat for my friend's birthday, she loved it .

data.text: Great service, and a child friendly garden area with climbing frame. Food arrived quickly and was nice across the board, particularly the burgers. Only cons would be, prices are a little steep, but to be expected in the area. They did get our daughters order wrong, but offered to change it with no fuss, we decided to have what they brought anyway as hungry kids will not be calmed! All in all, enjoyed our afternoon here, we will be back in the sunshine :-)
data.name: Oliver Woods

data.text: Nice food. Good service I would go back again.
data.name: Sam D

data.text:
Amazing food, pricy but very tasty.

Table service was brilliant and staff were friends and very knowledgeable. Fantastic time!
data.name: James Gibbison

data.text: Very friendly welcoming staff.  Food was good, however I am not a fan of the frozen chip brigade.  I always rate a place on the quality of the coffee.  I love my coffee black and strong, oops, not to my standard xx however I would go back xx
data.name: Brenda Kenyon

data.text:
A really nice pub set out in the countryside but just a short distance from Manchester Airport. A warning though that some of the roads around near the pub are very narrow and tight.
A great menu selection and a beautiful setting.
A really nice place to be and especially when the real wood burning fire is going.
A generous car park and beer garden for children to play along with a frame.
Well worth a visit.
data.name: Chris Smith

data.text: Food was excellent, plenty of parking in lovely grounds. Only criticism would be the staff could have been more attentive. We had just 1 gent serving the entire conservatory on a busy Sunday Lunchtime. Would definitely return.

data.text: Lovely rural venue with some good food (Cobb Salad and Fish & Chips). Friendly welcoming staff with a good  level of service. Just slightly let down by the amount of screaming kids and the venue could probably do with a few pounds spent on it.

data.text: Had a wonderful Christmas dinner at the p.& f. staff were very pleasant and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Very pleased. Mr & Mrs Woodyatt & friends.

data.text: Excellent Sunday dinner with lovely gravy. Great beers. Superb enormous portions. Lovely pub/restaurant, at end of long cul de sac. (When satnav says turn right 300 yards from destination go straight on). Children's play area. Picnic seats/tables in outside grasses area. Also patio seats/tables. Outdoor bar & bbq til midnight on 2nd September. Nice  walks nearby. Alpaca farm nearby.

data.text:
What a lovely pub !  Service was just fine, delicious meals served by a lovely waitress.
Ambiance very pleasant.. we will return soon!
data.name: Julieann Ainsworth

data.text: My wife and I have not visited the Plough and Flail for some time but we just knew that we woudl be guaranted a fine lunch.  We arrived at 12:30 without an appointment and the Jose Lourenco - the General Manager - found us a table despite a busy lunchtime. We ordered the Haddock and Chips which arrived amazingly quickly. The chips were rustic, twice-cooked and home made and the Haddock as beuatifully fresh with the thinnest, crispiest, tastiest batter I have tasted for a long time.  The Plough is a bit out of the way but it is well worth the journey. We will be returning for more.
data.name: Phil Derrig
